title: Linux chrt Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux chrt command, which allows you to adjust the real-time priority and scheduling policies of processes, with practical examples to enhance your process management skills.

meta.title: Linux chrt Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux chrt command, which allows you to adjust the real-time priority and scheduling policies of processes, with practical examples to enhance your process management skills.
meta.keywords: Linux, chrt, process management, real-time priority, scheduling policies, command line, system administration

steps.title: Understand the Purpose of the chrt Command

verify.name: Verify the current scheduling policy and priority
verify.hint: The current shell process should be using the SCHED_FIFO scheduling policy with a priority of 10. Please check the output of the `chrt -p $$` command.

steps.title: Adjust the Real-Time Priority of a Process

verify.name: Verify the real-time priority of the sleep process
verify.hint: The sleep process should be using the SCHED_FIFO scheduling policy with a priority of 20. Please check the output of the `chrt -p $(pgrep sleep)` command.

steps.title: Manage Scheduling Policies with the chrt Command

verify.name: Verify the scheduling policies of the sleep processes
verify.hint:
The sleep processes should be using the following scheduling policies:
- SCHED_FIFO with priority 10
- SCHED_RR with priority 15
- SCHED_BATCH
- SCHED_IDLE
Please check the output of the `chrt -p` command for each process.
